body.class: page-template-default page page-id-8412 wpb-js-composer js-comp-ver-6.1 vc_responsive

div.p: All Fitzgerald Public Schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year during the COVID-19 Pandemic.

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom current-menu-ancestor current-menu-parent menu-item-has-children menu-item-2370
menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page current-menu-item page_item page-item-8412 current_page_item menu-item-8436

div.p: This page is dedicated to providing up-to-date information on the coronavirus across federal, state, county and district levels. This is a very fluid situation, and we will keep you updated as information becomes available. It is important for the community to know that we are following the recommended guidelines of the health officials.

li.a: FPS Continuity of Learning COVID-19 Response Plan

p.span: More importantly, given the extensive media reporting and the changes in the school schedule, this can be a confusing and unsettling time for our children – no matter what their age.
includes helpful information for parents. I encourage you to talk to your children and have them share their feelings through conversations, journaling, or drawing.

strong.a: Parent/Caregiver Guide to Helping Families Cope with the Coronavirus Disease 2019

li.a: State of Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Macomb County Food Pantries & School Districts

p.span: It is necessary for Fitzgerald Public Schools to change our food distribution schedule. We WILL continue to provide a FREE grab-n-go breakfast and lunch for students up to age 18.

span.span: Bus delivery to bus routes will no longer be available.

div.p: Friday, April 17, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, April 24, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, May 1, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, May 8, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, May 15, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, May 22, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, May 29, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, June 5, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)
Friday, June 12, 2020 (Will receive food for 7 days)

p.span: We will continue with curbside pick up. We ask families to pull up, indicate how many student meals are needed, open your trunk or hatch and pull away. As always, thank you for your flexibility and understanding as we continue to provide assistance to our students while keeping our families, students and hard working staff safe.
